text: Staehelin in 2015 Jenö Staehelin (born 14 january 1940) is a Swiss diplomat and lawyer. He has served as the first Swiss Permanent Representative to the United Nations in New York from 2002 to 2004 and as President of the UNICEF Executive Board at the international level in 2003.Officers of the UNICEF Executive Board 1946–2014, UNICEFExecutive Board, UNICEF He was Vice President of the European Patent Office in Munich from 1977 to 1984. He has formerly been Swiss Ambassador to Japan from 1993 to 1997.Jenö Staehelin ==References== ==External links== * Category:Ambassadors of Switzerland to Japan Category:Chairmen and Presidents of UNICEF Category:Permanent Representatives of Switzerland to the United Nations Category:1940 births Category:Living people Category:Swiss officials of the United Nations
title: Jenö Staehelin
